thread.title: Nate Solder out for season
thread.title_full: Nate Solder out for season | Boston Herald

author: Jeff Howe
title: Nate Solder out for season
text:
FOXBORO — The Patriots placed left tackle Nate Solder on injured reserve yesterday, officially ending his season.
Solder suffered a torn biceps in his right arm Sunday during the Pats’ victory against the Dallas Cowboys, according to two sources.
Based on this season’s rotations, Marcus Cannon is expected to take over for Solder at left tackle with Sebastian Vollmer staying on the right side. The Patriots will have to figure out a new plan for the third tackle on the game-day roster, and that could be practice squad member Cameron Fleming. That transaction could come later in the week.
For now, the Pats have used their 53rd roster spot to pick up cornerback Rashaan Melvin, who was claimed off waivers from the Baltimore Ravens. Melvin has shown some potential but was benched in Week 3 and released yesterday when the Ravens shook up their roster with a flurry of moves after losing four of their first five games of the season.
Solder allowed two sacks and two quarterback hits against the Cowboys, and he surrendered a team-high three sacks through four games. However, he has historically improved over the course of each season, and the loss will also be felt in the ground game, as the Patriots routinely like to run to the left side.
On Sept. 9, Solder signed a two-year, $20.062 million contract extension that included a $12.5 million signing bonus. He remains under contract with the Patriots through the 2017 season.
